intro: Boerlagea, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow and orange. Boerlagea typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
